text: Allan Ramon "Red" Staley (September 21, 1928 – April 9, 2019) was a Canadian professional ice hockey player. He played as a centre. He played in one National Hockey League game for the New York Rangers during the 1948–49 NHL season. He was born in Regina, Saskatchewan Staley died on April 9, 2019 at a hospital in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. He was 90. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1928 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Canadian ice hockey centres Category:Ice hockey people from Saskatchewan Category:New Haven Ramblers players Category:New York Rangers players Category:Sportspeople from Regina, Saskatchewan Category:Eastern Hockey League players
title: Al Staley
